title: Lokesh urges Bihar voters to re-elect NDA for stability and progress
content: Andhra Pradesh IT and HRD Minister says law and order improved under NDA; warns against return to ‘jungle raj’ and cites Andhra experience as caution

title: Kerala Local Body Polls 2025: Both LDF, UDF harbour hopes in Kothamangalam
content: The rival fronts have each won the municipality twice since 2005. While the Assembly constituency has elected CPI(M) since 2016, in the parliamentary election, the Congress won a thumping majority. The ruling LDF hopes to continue its dominance and the UDF is eyeing a comeback. The BJP has no councillors in the outgoing council

title: Thriving ‘neer maruthu’ trees in Mudhumalai Tiger Reserve provide refuge for endangered vultures
content: Researchers enumerated the presence of more than 10,000 thriving Terminalia arjuna trees and noted the presence of 56 nests of White-rumped vultures in them.

title: China Eastern launches Shanghai-Delhi flight with near full capacity
content: China Eastern's Shanghai Pudong-Delhi route, operated by an Airbus A330 wide-body aircraft, will run three times a week on Wednesdays, Saturdays and Sundays.

title: Wild tuskers clash in Bikkodu in Belur taluk
content: The elephants, named Bhima and Captain by local people, came face to face and hit each other. One of Bhima’s tusks broke and was disjointed in the fight.

title: CRPF jawan injured in IED blast in Chhattisgarh's Sukma
content: The incident took place at 1.45 p.m. in the forested hills near Gogunda under Fulbagdi police station area when a team of security personnel was out on an area domination operation, a police official said

title: Preparations kick off at Sabarimala base camps ahead of pilgrimage season
content: Works on restoring the arch at Koratti Palam, the main entry point to Erumely will begin soon, say TDB officials

title: Yakshagana ‘melas’ in coastal Karnataka belt kickstart seven-month journey
content: Kukke Shree Subrahmanya Swamy Krupaposhita Yakshagana Mandali and the seventh troupe of Durgaparameshwari Prasadita Dashavatara Yakshagana Mandali of Kateel will be join the already existing over 40 ‘melas’ in the belt.

title: Provisions for vehicle-to-grid integration included in Kerala’s new renewable energy regulations
content: For promoting the evolving technology, a tariff of ₹10 per unit would apply for export of energy from V2G systems as “an initial measure,” say the regulations notified by the State Electricity Regulatory Commission

title: Madras High Court closes Latha Rajinikanth’s contempt plea against Kancheepuram Collector in land acquisition dispute
content: Issue relates to payment of enhanced compensation for the land acquired from her for the Chennai City Waterways Scheme in 2006

title: Assam government carries out eviction drive to clear 'encroachment' on 1,140 bigha forest land
content: ‘There were 580 families who had encroached on 1,140 bighas of land. The notices were issued to them more than 15 days ago to vacate the areas,’ says District Commissioner

title: Earthquake of 5.4 magnitude recorded in Andaman Sea: Seismology centre
content: The tremor was felt in parts of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, but there was no immediate report of any loss of life or damage to property, an official said.

title: Uttarakhand formation day: PM Modi inaugurates projects worth ₹8,260 crore
content: The projects inaugurated by the Prime Minister cater to several key sectors, including drinking water, irrigation, technical education, energy, urban development, sports, and skill development

title: Gujarat ATS nabs three conspiring to carry out terror attack; chemicals, weapons seized
content: The accused, one of whom hails from Telangana and two from U.P., were in Gujarat to exchange weapons and had conspired to carry out terrorist activities involving a potent poison, ‘ricin’, said the official

title: 'We will ensure change': Rahul greets Tejashwi on birthday
content: Tejashwi Yadav, who is the Chief Ministerial face of the Mahagathbandhan, turned 36 on November 9, 2025

title: RSS is recognised as body of individuals, Bhagwat tells critics
content: On the issue of RSS respecting only the saffron flags and not recognising the Indian tri-colour, Mohan Bhagwat said while saffron is treated as a Guru in RSS it has high respect for the Indian tri-colour

title: Classmate shoots at class 11 student using father's pistol in Gurugram: Police
content: An FIR has been registered at the Sadar police station, and two minor students have been apprehended in connection with the case

title: Recruitment of 18,000 teachers for government and aided schools underway, says Madhu Bangarappa
content: Mr. Bangarappa was participating in the centenary celebrations of Government Higher Primary School at Beluru Kusuburu village in Somwarpet taluk in Kodagu district

title: Bhajanlal, Vasundhara, Gehlot face test of influence in Anta bypoll; campaign to end today
content: This is not just an election. It is about continuing the work that brought relief to people, says Senior Congress leader Ashok Gehlot

title: Escalating political row over RSS anthem at Vande Bharat flag off function takes a regulatory turn
content: General Education Minister V Sivankutty has tasked the Director of General Education, Kerala, with investigating the episode and reporting any violations of the Kerala Educational Act and the Kerala Educational Rules, pushing the festering controversy into a legal trajectory within the State government’s jurisdictionary authority.

title: Vande Mataram row: Congress cites CWC statement of 1937, says PM 'insulted' Tagore
content: The Prime Minister has insulted this CWC as also Gurudev Rabindranath Tagore. That he should have done so is shocking but not surprising since the RSS had played no role in our Freedom Movement led by Mahatma Gandhi, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: Accused of rape, AAP’s Punjab MLA Harmit Singh Pathanmajra flees to Australia
content: The AAP MLA appeared in the video interview on Friday (November 7, 2025) with an Australia-based Punjabi web channel in which he claimed that he would "return home only after securing bail"

title: Mysuru tiger attacks: Big cat involved in three deaths captured in Sargur taluk
content: Forest Minister has directed officials to conduct a DNA test to verify whether the tiger, said to be around 12-13 years old, was the one behind the recent attacks in which three farmers lost their lives

title: Vice-President C.P. Radhakrishna unveils statue of Shanti Sagar Maharaj in Shravanabelagola
content: The Vice-President unveiled the statue and named the hillock in the presence of Karnataka Governor Thawarchand Gehlot, Jain mutt seer Charukeerthi Panditcharyavarya Bhattaraka Swamy, Union Minister H.D. Kumaraswamy and others.

title: In Frames: Andhra's coastal village Uppada on the brink
content: This coastal village in Andhra Pradesh has been losing shore to the Bay of Bengal at an alarming rate; since 2020, over 250 houses have already been swallowed by the sea, and recently, Cyclone Montha damaged at least a dozen more in just two days.

title: A.P. emerges as No. 1 State in implementing Energy Conservation Building Code
content: With approvals for 786 ECBC — compliant buildings, A.P. surpassed Telangana (738), Punjab (552), Uttar Pradesh (201), Haryana (100), Kerala (57) and Uttarakhand (12), according to an official release.

title: Aditya-L1: IIA-NASA collaborate to record spectroscopic observations of a CME in visible wavelength range for very first time
content: Scientists associated with the project said that these are the very first spectroscopic observations of a CME in the visible wavelength range

title: Anti-terror operations across Jammu, raids underway at dozens of places
content: During the operations, he said houses of relatives and known associates of active J&K-based terrorists operating from Pakistan and their overground workers were put to search

title: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif once again thanks Trump for resolving Indo-Pak conflict
content: In his address, Mr. Sharif also mentioned Kashmir, saying that Azerbaijan's victory in Karabakh is a beacon of hope for all nations fighting against oppression.

title: CJI, SCBA chief flag off walkathon of lawyers
content: The walkathon themed "Justice for All" has been organised by the Supreme Court Bar Association (SCBA)

title: Zohran Mamdani's Win Exposes Deep Rift In New York's Jewish Voters
content: Zohran Mamdani's election as New York's next mayor exposed a deepening rift between traditional Democratic Jewish voters and younger progressives - one that could reshape politics for years.

title: Exclusive: Inside Pak's Secret Unit 'S1' That Trains Terrorists To Attack India
content: A unit called "S1" in Pakistan's Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI) has played a big role in exporting terror to India, way back from the Mumbai blasts in 1993 to the recent terror attack on tourists in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam.

title: Dance, Daru, Drama: More Lapses Emerge At Bengaluru Central Jail
content: In more trouble for the authorities at Bengaluru Central Jail, a video has now emerged showing inmates dancing and partying with liquor and snacks.

title: 122 Seats, 3.7 Crore Votes, Seemanchal Battle: Decoding Bihar Polls Phase 2
content: The battelines are drawn, positions taken, speeches delivered, and dice cast: in the next few hours, campaigning for the second and last phase of the Assembly polls in Bihar will come to an end. The second phase of polling will take place on Tuesday.

title: Mohan Bhagwat Was Asked If Muslims Are Allowed In RSS. His Response
content: The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) supports policies, not an individual or a political party, its chief Mohan Bhagwat has said, adding that RSS workers would have even backed the Congress if it supported the demand for a Ram Temple in Ayodhya.

title: Turkish Delegation Heads To Pakistan To Broker Peace Deal With Afghanistan
content: Turkey's foreign and defence ministers and intelligence chief plan to travel to Pakistan this week to discuss its stop-start talks with Afghanistan on a ceasefire in South Asia, President Tayyip Erdogan said.

title: 'Not In Dictionary': Hamas Says Fighters In Rafah Will Not Surrender
content: Hamas fighters holed up in the Israeli-held Rafah area of Gaza will not surrender to Israel, the group's armed wing said on Sunday, urging mediators to find a solution to a crisis that threatens the month-old ceasefire.

title: Fossil Resembling 3-Horned Dinosaur, Triceratops, Found In UP's Saharanpur
content: A fossil believed to be of a Triceratops, the three-horned dinosaur, has been excavated along the banks of the Sahansara River in the Saharanpur district of Uttar Pradesh, according to a researcher.

title: Lucknow Jail Inmate Sends Threat Mail To High Court Judge Using Cop's Phone
content: An FIR has been registered against a man, accused of cyber fraud worth around Rs 3,700 crore and presently lodged in jail, for allegedly sending a threatening email to an Allahabad High Court judge using a police constable's phone.

title: Bihar Polls: Unemployment, Civic Issues Dominate In Jehanabad
content: Twenty-five-year-old Vikas Kumar, a science graduate from a local college, drives an autorickshaw for a living. But he hopes the next Bihar government in place following the current elections will change his fortune.

title: Rahul Gandhi Turns Up Late At Congress Training, Punished With 10 Push-Ups
content: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's late arrival at a training session for party workers in Madhya Pradesh earned him a punishment: 10 push-ups

title: Man, 23, Kidnaps, Assaults 6-Year-Old Boy Over 'Personal Grudge' In Delhi
content: A 23-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly kidnapping and assaulting a six-year-old boy in northwest Delhi's Subhash Place area over a personal grudge, police said on Sunday.

title: Over 1,700 US Flights Cancelled Amid Staffing Crisis, Government Shutdown
content: Air travel chaos continued across the United States this weekend as airlines cancelled more than 1,700 flights and thousands more were delayed due to severe staffing shortages among air traffic controllers.

title: 1 Dead, 1 Million Evacuated In Philippines As Super Typhoon Fung-Wong Nears
content: More than a million people have been evacuated, and at least one person has been killed as floodwaters rose in the Philippines on Sunday before Typhoon Fung-wong's expected landfall on the east coast.

title: After 11 Years, Hamas To Return Body Of Israeli Officer Killed In 2014
content: Hamas' armed wing said it would hand over on Sunday the body of Israeli officer Lieutenant Hadar Goldin, who was killed during the 2014 war in Gaza.

title: "Enough Is Enough": A Warning After ISIS Recruiter Seen Using Phone In Bengaluru Jail
content: Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara has warned jail officials of strict action following major security lapses at Bengaluru Central Jail.

title: "You Know Mamdani?": Indian-Origin Worker Grilled By ICE Agents In US
content: An Indian-origin man, working with the Illinois Department of Transportation (IDOT) was grilled about his immigration status on duty.

title: "Unfair After Long Years Of Service": Shashi Tharoor Defends LK Advani
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has defended veteran politician Lal Krishna Advani after his birthday wishes for the senior BJP leader drew harsh criticism from a lawyer online.

title: Karnataka Man Arrested For Forcing Minor Sister Into Physical Intimacy, Impregnating Her
content: A 21-year-old man was arrested for allegedly forcing his minor sister into having a physical relationship and impregnating her, in Karnataka's Koppal, police said.

title: 8 Bengal Officers Get Notice For Distributing Voter Revision Forms On Tea Stalls
content: The Election Commission on Sunday issued show-cause notices to eight BLOs in West Bengal for allegedly distributing voter enumeration forms from tea stalls and local clubs instead of going door-to-door during the ongoing SIR of electoral rolls.

title: ‘They were holding a grudge’: Teen shoots schoolmate with father’s pistol; 2 accused arrested
content: A 17-year-old boy allegedly shot his schoolmate with his father's licensed pistol in Gurgaon's Sector 48, leaving the victim critically injured. The accused and another minor friend were apprehended shortly after the incident. Police recovered the weapon and ammunition from the rented accommodation, with the motive reportedly stemming from a two-month-old argument.

title: Who is Akash Kumar? Meghalaya batter who broke world record for fastest First-Class fifty
content: Meghalaya's Akash Kumar etched his name in cricketing history by smashing the fastest-ever First-Class fifty in just 11 balls during a Ranji Trophy match. The 25-year-old's explosive innings, featuring eight consecutive sixes, shattered the previous world record and stunned onlookers.  Kumar's remarkable feat has propelled him into global cricketing immortality.

title: Can Muslims join RSS? Mohan Bhagwat answers; explains who is 'not allowed' in Sangh
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat stated the organization welcomes individuals from all faiths, including Muslims and Christians, provided they identify as "sons of Bharat Mata" and part of Hindu society. He clarified that the RSS focuses on unity and a shared national identity, not caste or religion, and defended its legal standing as a recognized organization.

title: World Cup hero Kranti Gaud’s dad to get back cop job
content: Madhya Pradesh chief minister Mohan Yadav has assured that Munna Singh Gaud, the father of women’s World Cup–winning cricketer Kranti Gaud, will be reinstated as police constable. Gaud was dismissed in 2012 after an alleged error during election duty. The announcement came during Kranti’s felicitation ceremony in Bhopal, where the CM commended the bowler for bringing glory to the nation and her state.

title: Vande Mataram row: Congress hits back at PM with 'proof', says CWC followed Tagore's advice
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh criticised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for linking the 1937 Vande Mataram statement to India's partition. Ramesh cited Mahatma Gandhi's collected works and Rabindranath Tagore's advice, stating the CWC's decision to use only the first two stanzas was to avoid religious references and unite against British rule.

title: Bill Gates on foundation’s role; not replacing US aid: ‘That’s not our job’
content: The Gates Foundation has pledged $2.5 billion over five years to advance global women's health, marking a significant increase in their investment. This funding will primarily support research and development for innovations like self-injectable contraceptives and rapid STI diagnostics, aiming to address long-overlooked health disparities and catalyze broader action.

title: 'Like Nehru, Indira': Tharoor on Advani's legacy; argues 'don't reduce career to one episode'
content: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor lauded veteran BJP leader LK Advani on his birthday. Tharoor compared Advani's legacy to that of Jawaharlal Nehru and Indira Gandhi. This drew criticism online, with some accusing him of downplaying Advani's controversial political history. Advani's 1990 Ram Rath Yatra and the subsequent Babri Masjid demolition remain significant events in India's past.

title: 'He is more valuable than Bumrah': Former cricketer's remark sparks debate
content: Former Indian batter Subramaniam Badrinath lauded Varun Chakaravarthy, calling him the world's top T20I bowler and more valuable than Jasprit Bumrah. Badrinath highlighted Chakaravarthy's crucial role in restricting runs and taking wickets, especially during the recent series against Australia. He emphasized Chakaravarthy's significant comeback and his potential to be a key factor in the upcoming T20 World Cup.

title: Pune land sale row: Ajit Pawar defends son Parth; asserts 'truth will come out soon'
content: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar confirmed an inquiry into alleged irregularities in a Pune land sale linked to his son, Parth Pawar. A probe committee, headed by Additional Chief Secretary Vikas Kharge, will investigate the Rs 1,800 crore land sold for Rs 300 crore. Pawar stated the truth will emerge soon, emphasizing transparency and adherence to law.

title: Canada’s $1.2 bn plan to woo H-1B visa holders; reveals new immigration plan
content: Canada is rolling out a new immigration strategy, aiming to attract over 1,000 top researchers with a $1.2 billion investment. The nation plans to welcome 380,000 permanent residents annually from 2026-2028.  An accelerated pathway for H-1B visa holders is also in the works, potentially drawing skilled professionals from the US.

title: Star anise tea for warmth, digestive relief and respiratory comfort in the cold
content: Star anise evening tea is gaining popularity this cold season. Its warm, liquorice flavour provides comfort and digestive ease. While linked to antiviral research through shikimic acid, experts confirm it is a supportive wellness drink, not a medicine. Simple to prepare, this caffeine-free infusion offers relaxation and aids sleep. Always use authentic Chinese star anise for safety.

title: 'Sacrifice him & keep Dhruv Jurel': Ex-cricketer's brutal India Test XI call
content: Dhruv Jurel's twin centuries for India A against South Africa A have intensified the selection debate for the upcoming Test series. Former cricketer Aakash Chopra believes Jurel deserves a place in the XI, suggesting a middle-order alteration. Ravichandran Ashwin also praised Jurel's form, making it difficult for selectors to overlook him.

title: 'Success takes time': Nvidia CEO tells Zuckerberg- here's what he said
content: Nvidia's Jensen Huang and Meta's Mark Zuckerberg shared insights on AI's future and building tech empires. Huang humorously wished he'd dropped out like Zuckerberg, while both acknowledged their long journeys and mutual admiration. Nvidia's remarkable rise to a $5 trillion valuation was highlighted, contrasting with Zuckerberg's own dorm-room beginnings leading to Meta's trillion-dollar status.

title: 'Will return after bail’: Rape-accused AAP MLA flees to Australia; escaped custody
content: AAP MLA Harmit Singh Pathanmajra, wanted in a rape case, is believed to have fled to Australia after a video interview. He denied allegations, calling it a political conspiracy, and stated he would return after securing bail. Police have issued a lookout notice and initiated proceedings to declare him a proclaimed offender.

title: UBT's Aditya Thackeray claims MMRDA's drone 'peeped into his house'
content: Aditya Thackeray objected to a drone flying over his Bandra East home, alleging it was "peeping into his home." Police clarified the Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) was conducting a survey for a proposed pod taxi service. Thackeray questioned the lack of resident notification and the survey's purpose.

title: 'LoP means Leader of Partying': BJP's jibe at Congress; calls out Rahul Gandhi's Pachmarhi jungle safari
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party has criticised Rahul Gandhi's recent jungle safari in Madhya Pradesh. They labelled his position as 'Leader of Paryatan' or 'Leader of Partying'. The BJP claims this shows Congress's disconnect from electoral realities. They also allege that the party blames the Election Commission of India when facing electoral defeats.

title: IGIA ATC glitch — 'Critical need to prioritise modernisation': Air traffic managers raise red flag
content: Air traffic professionals are demanding urgent modernization of communication, navigation, and surveillance systems at major Indian airports, citing a recent Delhi ATC shutdown due to outdated technology. The Air Traffic Safety Electronic Personnel Association (ATSEPA) and the Air Traffic Controllers’ Guild have repeatedly warned aviation authorities about systemic imbalances and the neglect of technical advice, impacting operational efficiency and safety margins amidst rapid air traffic growth.

title: Video: Moment tornado hit Brazil's Parana; six killed, hundreds injured
content: A devastating tornado has ripped through Brazil's Parana state, claiming at least six lives and injuring nearly 750 people. The powerful twister, with winds up to 250 km/h, obliterated 90% of Rio Bonito do Iguacu in less than a minute.  Aerial views show widespread destruction, with authorities fearing the death toll may climb as rescue efforts continue.

title: 'Have to speak the language they understand': RSS chief on Pakistan
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat issued a stern warning to Pakistan, stating India will respond firmly to provocations and must "speak the language they understand." He emphasised that consistent, firm responses will eventually compel Pakistan to cooperate rather than compete, asserting India's desire for peace while vowing to punish any breaches.

title: Record in Pakistan! Quinton de Kock equals MS Dhoni's rare feat
content: Quinton de Kock's triumphant return to international cricket sees him equal MS Dhoni's record of seven Player of the Series awards for a wicketkeeper in ODIs.  His stellar batting against Pakistan, including a century and two fifties, also propelled him past 7,000 ODI runs, marking him as a true elite performer.

title: Pistol, live cartridges recovered: ATS arrests 3 planning terror attacks across country
content: Gujarat ATS apprehended three suspects allegedly planning nationwide terrorist attacks. The trio, under surveillance for a year, were caught while supplying weapons. This arrest is part of a larger operation targeting arms smuggling and terror funding networks.

title: Pakistan’s manufacturing sector slumps; experts warn of long-term industrial decay
content: Pakistan's manufacturing sector faces a severe crisis, with private investment plummeting 46% in six years. Experts warn of industrial disintegration due to policy instability, high energy costs, and volatile currency. This decline threatens exports, jobs, and economic resilience, contrasting sharply with neighboring countries' growth.

title: After Darshan's viral pic, terror accused seen using smartphones inside Bengaluru jail
content: Videos of prisoners, including serial rapist Umesh Reddy and a terror case accused, using mobile phones inside Bengaluru's Central Prison have surfaced. This security lapse has prompted an inquiry into how the phones were provided and who is involved. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has ordered a report and action against those responsible.

title: IPL 2026 auction likely on Dec 15: WPL mega sale on Nov 27; big names released
content: The IPL 2026 auction is slated for December 15, with a potential return to India for the venue. Meanwhile, the Women's Premier League auction is scheduled for November 27 in Delhi, featuring key retentions and notable releases ahead of the event. This will be the first mega auction of the WPL since the inaugural auction.

title: ‘Even Hindu Dharma is not registered’: Mohan Bhagwat addresses row
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat defended the organization's status as a body of individuals, questioning the need for registration with the British government and highlighting post-independence recognition. He also addressed the 'Love Jihad' concept, attributing its perceived success to a failure in imparting Hindu values to children, while cautioning against generalizing about the Muslim community.

title: 'Saare badmash issi pe chalte hain': Haryana top cop on Thar, bullet bike
content: Haryana's top police officer, OP Singh, identified Mahindra Thars and Bullet motorcycles as high-risk vehicles often associated with reckless driving and rogue elements. He emphasized polite police checks and warned that drivers of these vehicles, along with high-performance cars, will face scrutiny. Singh also announced plans to bolster the state's cyber police unit.

title: ‘Everyone seems like an enemy’: Tej Pratap Yadav claims ‘threat to life’; security beefed up
content: Janshakti Janta Dal Chief Tej Pratap Yadav stated his security has been enhanced due to a threat to his life. He confirmed the increased security in Patna, citing personal danger. Sources suggest local intelligence inputs prompted the measure, though officials have not yet commented.

title: IND vs AUS: Washington Sundar handed special award after series win - watch
content: Washington Sundar was named 'Impact Player of the Series' for his consistent performances in India's T20I victory over Australia. He showcased his versatility with a match-winning 49 off 23 balls in one game and a crucial three-wicket burst in another, securing the series for India. He was in the XI for the final T20I but did not feature since the match was called off.

title: Uttarakhand infra boost: PM Modi unveils over Rs 8,000 cr projects in Dehradun
content: Uttarakhand celebrated its Silver Jubilee with Prime Minister Modi inaugurating development projects worth over Rs 8,140 crore. Key initiatives include water supply, energy, sports, and education, alongside a Rs 62 crore direct transfer to over 28,000 farmers. The PM also released a commemorative postal stamp, marking a significant milestone for the state.

title: 'Feels like betrayal': Amazon recruiter laid off; AI reshapes job security
content: Global tech giants are restructuring their workforces, impacting thousands of white-collar jobs. Companies like Amazon, Google, and Meta are prioritizing AI and automation, leading to layoffs in roles once considered secure.  This shift emphasizes efficiency over loyalty, forcing professionals to adapt.  The future of work demands continuous learning and adaptability as AI reshapes industries and job roles.

title: West Bengal: 4-year-old girl kidnapped, found bleeding near Kolkata; grandfather arrested
content: A four-year-old child was found severely injured near Tarakeshwar railway station after being abducted from her home. Her grandfather has been arrested in connection with the incident. Allegations of delayed police action and a potential sexual assault have led to protests and a renewed investigation.

title: Indore: ‘Drunk’ ASI rams SUV into multiple bikes, kills man; eyewitnesses describe moment
content: A police officer in Neemuch has been suspended and arrested for a fatal crash that killed a teacher and critically injured four others, including his own family. The assistant sub-inspector allegedly drove his SUV into multiple vehicles. Eyewitnesses reported he was heavily intoxicated, with liquor bottles found in his car. The victim's family protested, demanding justice.

title: ‘I was trying to rub my back’: Rapido driver to cops in Bengaluru molestation case
content: A Rapido bike-taxi captain was arrested for allegedly sexually harassing a 20-year-old woman passenger in Bengaluru. The accused claimed he was rubbing his aching back, but the victim stated he continued touching her leg despite her objections. Police registered a case after the woman narrated her ordeal on Instagram.

title: 'What’s the problem?': German tourist harassed by local cabbies in Goa; taxi-app turf war deepens
content: A German travel influencer faced harassment in Goa when local rickshaw drivers demanded an exorbitant fare, forcing him to use the app-based GoaMiles. The situation escalated with threats, police intervention, and a fine for the GoaMiles driver, highlighting a growing turf war impacting tourism.

title: ‘War’s most challenging night’: Ukraine’s power generation at ‘zero’
content: Russia launched a massive wave of drone and missile strikes, crippling Ukraine's energy infrastructure and reducing power generation to zero.  The state power company reported its facilities were completely knocked out, leading to widespread, prolonged power outages across multiple regions as repairs continue.

title: From toasted to roasted: Trump wines sales in military cantonments invite flak
content: US military stores are reportedly selling Trump-branded wines, sparking ethical concerns despite official claims of legality. This incident echoes broader accusations of the Trump family's self-enrichment, including a crypto venture with Pakistan that critics allege strained US-India ties. Lavish White House events during a government shutdown also drew sharp criticism for insensitivity.

title: Why experts call calf muscles the body’s ‘second heart’ & 5 ways to keep them strong
content: A powerful muscle in the lower body quietly supports the heart’s work every single day. Experts say it plays a far greater role in circulation and vitality than most people realise.

title: IPO rush ahead! 5 issues to hit the market eyeing Rs 10,000 cr — What to know
content: Get ready for a busy IPO week as five companies prepare to raise over Rs 10,000 crore. From edtech giant PhysicsWallah to automotive component maker Tenneco Clean Air India and solar firm Emmvee Photovoltaic Power, the mainboard sees significant action. Two smaller firms, Mahamaya Lifesciences and Workmates Core2Cloud Solution, will also launch on the SME platform, testing market appetite.

title: 'It's T20, but he still... ': South Africa legend praises Rohit; leaves out Kohli
content: Former South African captain Hashim Amla has lauded Indian cricketer Rohit Sharma, naming him among his top T20 batters on the planet at the moment. Amla's glowing remarks, shared in a recent interview, have gained significant traction online. The veteran is anticipated to rejoin the Indian squad for the upcoming ODI series against South Africa, commencing November 30.

title: Don’t alienate 1.6 acres of temple land in Chennai: Madras High Court
content: Justice P.B. Balaji passes the interim order on a writ petition filed by two trustees of the 343-year-old Kandakottam Kandaswamy Temple near Central Railway Station

title: SIR a bid to institutionalise 'vote theft', claims Rahul Gandhi
content: After looking at that, after looking at the data, I believe that the same thing happened in MP, Maharashtra and Chhattisgarh. And this is the system of the BJP and EC (Election Commission), alleges Congress leader Rahul Gandhi

title: Madhya Pradesh school gets steel plates after video with children eating on newspapers sparks outrage
content: The video of food served on newspapers went viral on Tuesday (November 4), following which the authorities  cancelled the contract of the self-help group responsible for preparing meals

title: Mother of late BRS MLA Gopinath seeks inquiry into son’s death, alleges negligence and foul play
content: Mahananda Kumari further alleged that she was denied access to her son while he was in intensive care at AIG Hospital

title: State urges CCI to lift curbs on cotton procurement to help ryots
content: Minister for Agriculture Tummala Nageswara Rao asks CCI CMD L.K. Gupta to increase max. moisture content to 20%, per acre cotton purchase to 12 quintals

title: NGT directs Rajasthan government to rehabilitate villagers affected by mining
content: The NGT’s order includes ₹50,000 each to villagers whose houses have been damaged as per an official list and ₹20,000 each to villagers as per another list for environmental damage and health impacts

title: Darjeeling schools exempted from singing West Bengal State anthem in assemblies: Gorkhaland administration
content: The West Bengal government, on November 4, issued a notification that Rabindranath Tagore song ‘Banglar Mati, Banglar Jol’  will be sung in morning assembly in schools across the State

title: Erstwhile BBMP’s plans on strays in spotlight now
content: To ramp up the Animal Birth Control (ABC) drive, the BBMP had proposed setting up veterinary hospitals with adequate facilities in all its zones

title: Bihar Assembly election LIVE: Amit Shah charges Opposition with trying to build 'corridor for infiltrators' in State
content: When the government at the Centre was helmed by Manmohan Singh, Sonia Gandhi and Lalu, terrorists struck at will on our soil. In contrast, now we are beating up the terrorists inside their homes, says Union Home Minister Amit Shah

title: The monsoon beats a menacing retreat in Marathwada
content: It has been a month since Marathwada, a drought-prone region, was ravaged by unprecedented floods, leaving 108 people dead and over 45,000 in shelters. Marginal farmers, who form at least 75% of the area’s farmer population, are the worst affected, many trapped under the burden of debt. Vinaya Deshpande Pandit visits Beed district to find that as farmers wait for government-promised aid, the rabi sowing has been disrupted with the damaged soil and retreating monsoon

title: Climate change, imbalance in fertiliser use kill soil’s organic carbon: ICAR study
content: Team of scientists study more than two lakh soil samples to find out impact of loss of natural soil carbon, suggests measures to Governments to address situation

title: Exercise Trishul to boost integrated readiness across multiple domains: Defence Ministry
content: The training will culminate in a mega combat exercise, validating precision-targeting and multi-domain coordination.

title: Enforcement Directorate raids multiple locations in West Bengal in trafficking racket case
content: Over ₹1 crore cash, luxury cars, and digital evidence seized; investigation reveals large-scale exploitation of women

title: How is AI going to be regulated in India? | Explained
content: What are the government’s India AI Governance Guidelines? Why have guidelines become necessary? What is the key thrust? How do the guidelines look at AI models for Indian circumstances? What are the concerns it raises about AI usage and intellectual property rights?

title: What’s the plan to relocate forest tribes? | Explained
content: What will happen to those living in traditional forest habitats within tiger reserves? What are they guaranteed under the Forest Rights Act? Why did a directive from the National Tiger Conservation Authority prompt the setting up of a new policy framework?

title: Consumer forums across Tamil Nadu direct banks to pay compensation to cyber fraud victims
content: They hold banks accountable for service deficiencies and failure to recover lost funds, say banks continue to ignore RBI’s guidelines on unauthorised transactions; victims are defrauded by scamsters posing as bank employees, through fake links

title: Five-hour rescue operation saves driver trapped in mangled cabin
content: After being pulled out of the wreckage, Dharmendra Singh was shifted to a private hospital in Kalaburagi city for further treatment

title: Students put ideas to test as State School Science Festival opens in Palakkad
content: A special segment for differently abled students showcased their talents, turning the fair into a fresh, inspiring experience.

title: Central teams laud healthcare services in Chittoor, Parvathipuram Manyam districts
content: Teams note better public response to chronic disease screening, appreciate support for ASHAs, and suggest steps to improve health infrastructure

title: Forget police security, they didn’t even file an FIR despite threats to my life: Rana Ayyub
content: Journalist Rana Ayyub, who has been subject to online harassment for years, speaks of the latest threat she’s facing

title: Cong fighting same battle against 'Modi empire' that Mahatma Gandhi fought against British: Priyanka
content: Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra addresses back-to-back rallies in Bihar’s Katihar, Bhagalpur, and Purnea districts, jabs the NDA government over ‘katta’ remarks, unemployment and more

title: In a first for T.N., Chennai Metro Rail becomes ‘green corridor’ to transport lungs for transplantation
content: After arriving from Bengaluru, the organs were taken by train from the Meenambakkam Metro to AG-DMS Metro; then, they were transported to Apollo Hospitals on Greams Road in an ambulance

title: Fearing defeat, DMK government announced free laptops for students: Palaniswami
content: The AIADMK general secretary alleges that there is no safety for children and women under DMK rule and drugs are available everywhere

title: Implementation of projects signed in ‘Rising Rajasthan’ being expedited
content: The three-day investment summit held in Jaipur from December 9 to 11, 2024 had facilitated the signing of MoUs worth ₹35 lakh crore.

title: Congress chief rubbishes claims of NDA victory in Bihar, cites ‘400-plus rhetoric’ ahead of LS polls
content: Kharge insisted that “all was not well” in the BJP-led coalition, as there were doubts that Nitish Kumar, the JD(U) president and longest-serving Chief Minister, would be backed for another term in office

title: What is your ‘gut feeling’ about mental health?
content: Experts at Manotsava, the mental health festival under way in Bengaluru, spoke about emerging research that is validating the traditional wisdom that good digestion is the foundation of both physical and emotional health

title: 88,000 ‘infiltrators sent back’ during 10-year UPA regime, claims Digvijaya Singh
content: Criticising the ongoing second phase of SIR taking place across many States, including Madhya Pradesh, the Congress leader says the BJP-led Centre has only been able to find 2,400 infiltrators for repatriation in 11 years

title: New vessel rules to promote workers’ cooperatives in fishing sector
content: The rules will ‘not only facilitate deep-sea fishing but will also contribute to enhancing seafood exports by emphasising value addition, traceability, and certification’, the Union Fisheries Ministry said

title: Skill development institute to be set up at an investment of ₹100 crore
content: The institute is being set up to help students and job aspirants to develop their skills, considering the proximity to major industrial units in Kalamassery like FACT, TCC, BPCL, and Cochin Shipyard Limited, says Kerala Industries Minister

title: Buddha relics reach Bhutan as India’s ‘gift’ for Global Peace Prayer Festival
content: Thousands of Buddhists from the Himalayan country and beyond have converged for mass prayers for peace on earth

title: In Bihar’s villages, microfinance has changed from a promise of empowerment to a deadly debt trap
content: Bihar holds 15% of India’s microfinance portfolio, the largest among States; with outstanding loans at ₹57,712 crore, those caught in the debt trap have little hope that the ongoing election will change their plight

title: ₹21-crore detailed project report prepared for development of Kapavaram Buddhist site
content: The State will seek financial support from the Ministry of Culture under the Scheme of Financial Assistance for the Development of Buddhist/Tibetan Culture and Art, says Rajanagaram MLA

title: Centre undermining local languages to prioritise Sanskrit: Hampana
content: ‘The Union government is pushing for One Language, One Nation, One Election while systematically stifling people’s languages. A major portion of the language funding is being used to promote Sanskrit alone’

title: Indiana rallies to stay unbeaten in 'improbable' win
content: No. 2 Indiana scores on an improbable Omar Cooper Jr. toe-top touchdown catch with 36 seconds remaining to avoid its first loss of the season and beat Penn State 27-24.

title: Spurs' Fox hits ground running, has 24 in debut
content: De'Aaron Fox scored 24 points in his season debut for the Spurs, a 126-119 win over the Pelicans on Saturday night.

title: Elko bristles at past, urges 9-0 Aggies to 'finish'
content: Texas A&M keeps defying its recent history of weak finishes, scoring another road win and moving to 9-0 for the first time since 1992 with Saturday's 38-17 rout of Missouri.

title: Boozer twins start strong in home debut for Duke
content: Cameron and Cayden Boozer thrived in their freshman debut at Duke, with Cameron going for 25 points, 8 rebounds and 5 assists in a blowout win.

title: Messi's brace leads Miami to 1st playoff series win
content: Lionel Messi's first-half brace propelled Inter Miami to a 4-0 victory over Nashville SC to advance in the MLS playoffs for the first time in club history.

title: Texas Tech LB Rodriguez flashes Heisman pose
content: Texas Tech linebacker Jacob Rodriguez struck a Heisman Trophy pose during another dominating defensive performance by the ninth-ranked Red Raiders, leading his club to a stifling 29-7 Big 12 victory over previously undefeated No. 8 BYU on Saturday.

title: Ducks ignore 'outside noise,' improve CFP hopes
content: Atticus Sappington kicked a 39-yard field goal with 3 seconds left, and the No. 6 Oregon Ducks escaped with an 18-16 victory over the Iowa Hawkeyes on a rainy Saturday night in a Big Ten matchup that featured two of the country's top scoring defenses.

title: 🏈 Fantasy playbook: Week 10 lineup locks, more
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Ready for Week 10? We have NFL sleepers, QB questions, trends to watch and more
content: Will J.J. McCarthy work more outside the pocket? How will Sauce Gardner fare in his Colts debut? Upset brewing in Patriots-Bucs? Here's what to know for Week 10.

title: Berlin debut: Scenes from Falcons-Colts on NFL's stage in Germany
content: The NFL will have its first game in Berlin in Week 10. Here's what the Falcons and Colts got up to before kickoff Sunday.

title: Buzz: When can we expect Puka Nacua, Brock Purdy back in lineup?
content: What fantasy managers need to know about Puka Nacua, Brock Purdy and when each could be back in the lineup.

title: USC's sneaky fake punt, newlywed Texas Tech fans top college football Week 11 superlatives
content: USC got tricky with its jersey numbers for a fake punt, Texas Tech fans made it to "College GameDay" after a wedding and more from Week 11.

title: 'Never seen anything like this': Cignetti leads best quips of Week 11 in college football
content: Curt Cignetti and Joey McGuire were among the coaches to sound off with memorable quotes after Week 11.

content: Well, things escalated quickly. Which teams made the best -- and worst -- moves before the NFL trade deadline? We're making sense of all the action.

title: 💰 Best fits for top MLB free agents
content: Free agency starts at 5 p.m. ET Thursday. Here are some pairings we'd love to see as this winter gets underway.

title: ⚾ Sources: Japanese home run king Murakami posts
content: Japanese star third baseman Munetaka Murakami, who owns the single-season home run record for a Japanese player in Nippon Professional Baseball, is entering the posting system for MLB teams, sources told ESPN.

title: 📈 Ohio St., IU, Texas A&M, Bama top CFP ranking
content: In the first rankings of the College Football Playoff, coach Ryan Day and unbeaten Ohio State topped the list, followed by Big Ten foe Indiana at No. 2 with Texas A&M third and Alabama landing at four.

title: ⚾ Former MLB star Strawberry pardoned by Trump
content: President Donald Trump has pardoned former MLB great Darryl Strawberry, the 1983 NL Rookie of the Year and an eight-time All-Star, of tax evasion and drug charges dating back to the latter part of his playing career.

title: Chaotic Man United vs. Spurs finale another roller coaster of emotions for fans
content: Tottenham fans thought their team had come from behind to beat Manchester United, only to concede a 96th-minute equalizer in a 2-2 draw.

title: 15 NFL experts, 15 midseason predictions: We made our best calls for tight playoff races, more

title: Izzo guides Michigan St. past Calipari, Arkansas
content: no. 22 Michigan State beat no. 14 Arkansas 69-66 in a matchup of Hall of Fame coaches . the Spartans grabbed 19 offensive rebounds and converted them into 18 points . freshmen darius Acuff Jr. and Meleek Thomas scored 16 points on 5 of 16 shooting .

title: Giants' 'Vintage White,' Broncos' throwbacks lead NFL Week 10 uniforms

title: Interstellar visitor 3I/ATLAS loses tail, baffles astronomers about its identity
content: the third interstellar visitor 3I/ATLAS is changing shapes and emitting different colours . some astronomers say it could be a natural comet, others indicate that it might be an alien ship . renowned astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson has also claimed that it could show unusual but natural characteristics like outgassing.
